abstract: Two former executives also will pay fines to settle charges that the company exploited a Medicare loophole.
snippet: Two former executives also will pay fines to settle charges that the company exploited a Medicare loophole.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 2 (Dow Jones/AP) — Tenet Healthcare, one of the largest United States health care companies, agreed Monday to pay a $10 million civil penalty to settle charges that it failed to disclose that its earnings growth from 1999 to 2002 was driven by its exploitation of a loophole in the Medicare reimbursement system.

headline.main: Tenet Healthcare to Pay $10 Million Civil Fine
